verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Lamp of our feet! whereby we trace Our path, when wont to stray; Stream from the fount of heav'nly grace! Brook by the trav'ler's way!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Bread of our souls! whereon we feed; True manna from on high! Our guide, and chart wherein we read Of realms beyond the sky.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Pillar of fire\through watches dark! Or radiant cloud by day! When waves would whelm our tossing bark\Our anchor and our stay!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Pole\star on life's tempestuous deep! Beacon! when doubts surround; Compass! by which our course we keep; Our deep sea\lead, to sound!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Riches in poverty! our aid In every needful hour! Unshaken rock! the pilgrim's shade; The soldier's fortress tow'r.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Our shield and buckler in the fight!
Vict'ry's triumphant palm!
Comfort in grief! in weakness, might!
In sickness, Gilead's balm.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
Childhood's preceptor! manhood's trust!
Old age's firm ally!
Our hope\-when we go down to dust,
Of immortality.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines:
Pure oracles of truth divine!
Unlike each fabled dream
Given forth from Delphos' mystic shrine
Or groves of Academe!

verse.name: v9
verse.lines:
Word of the ever-living God!
Will of His glorious Son!
Without Thee, how could earth be trod?
Or Heaven itself be won?

verse.name: v10
verse.lines:
Yet to unfold thy hidden worth,
Thy mysteries to reveal,
That Spirit which first gave thee forth,
Thy volume must unseal!

verse.name: v11
verse.lines:
And we, if we aright would learn
The wisdom it imparts,
Must to its heavenly teaching turn
With simple, child-like hearts!
